result.execSummary:
The defendant Colin D Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: WIth Huber. Release for standard conditions. Sentence credit of 3 days was granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. May also pay at $200.00 per month commencing 12/01/15 to agent.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

No Contact with the victim. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colin D Adams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Colin D Adams in court with attorney Theodore C. Seraphim.  David Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting plea and sentencing date. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Colin D Adams in court with attorney Theodore C. Seraphim.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment as they don't have Discovery. State has no objections. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with E.N.S.

Defendant Colin D Adams in court, in custody, with attorney Theodore C. Seraphim.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
